text: Bomb BBQ. Every time we come to phoenix we stop by.  Same only problem it's a Pepsi account but they have mexican coke.

Good Texas Brisket served the way you like it, either moist or lean with sliced white bread. The ribs were ok, the beans plain and the sausage was again just ok but their brisket is great! I will be back!

I am a native Texan, and felt that Phoenix has been definitely lacking in the BBQ area.... not anymore! This brisket is awesome! So flavorful... don't need the sauce, just the way it should be. My only complaint is that they ran out of food! My fault for getting there at the end of the day. Also, proves that the food is good because they are selling out! I will be a repeat customer, for sure! The owner came by and thanked us for our business, and the other employee were friendly, too. Great experience, even better food!

Texas APPROVED!  Being born and raised in Texas, this was the perfect place to try while visiting Phoenix. I got the lunch special which was 1/3 pound of any sliced meat, side and a drink for $10.99. I chose the brisket which was flavorful, moist and very tender. They cut and weigh the meat in front where you can see and serve everything on a tray with parchment paper rather than plates. The sweet BBQ sauce is just right and a great compliment to the brisket. I highly recommend it and can't wait to come back when in town.

Good environment, brisket is phenomenal. If you are hungry try the Texas Po-boy, pulled pork, brisket and smoked sausage on a bun. The mac & cheese used to be delicious...cheesy with flavor, seems the last couple of times it was lukewarm and the cheese was gritty. Other than that, great place. Staff is nice.

My wife is from Texas and loves BBQ. She has been in love with Dickies BBQ until one day I decided to switch things up. I came over to this BBQ place and wanted her to try it. Brought it home and her first reaction was this is my favorite BBQ. It's a million times better than Dickies. I ordered us the pulled pork and the serving sizes are very generous and better than most places. The Texas Po' Boy was AMAZING. The price is right for any appetite :) 
This place is a must. If you haven't tried it, you're missing out.

Passed by last week and decided to stop for lunch.  Brisket was amazing almost as good as we get in Kansas City.  I would recommend checking it out.  Got my food fast and service at the counter was very friendly.  Great job!!

I decided to try Texas BBQ House after seeing a menu that was dropped off at my work. First impression is it is a small place in a not so good location. A couple previous restaraunts were in the same location and had to close shop. To put it simply, I hope this place does not go anywhere. The beef brisket is great. Worth 4 stars itself. Barbecue sauce is on the sweet side but very tasty. Most meats are sold by weight. You have to arrive early if you want the moist brisket as it sells out early. The sides are not too much to brag about. Simple cream corn and baked beans are good, coleslaw is made fresh as I saw them preparing it in the kitchen, potato salad tastes as if it is purchased pre made.

I have eaten here about a dozen times and it always has good food. I however found another place that has a better smoke flavor to their brisket. Rudy's. Rudy's uses a real wood fired Oyler Smoker that produces a consistantly better flavor than Texas BBQ House. I will still eat here when I am in the area but if I had to choose, I am going to Rudy's as both places are the same distance from where I live.

I can never get here early enough. They are always closed, earlier than 7pm on top of that. Tried on Friday around 5:30pm four different occasions and they were closed each time. Are they only open for lunch or run out of food?

Love the food and service. My first time they helped me order and I was very pleased.
These guys know how to BBQ. Awesome.

Was looking for some good BBQ after a long day of hiking...

THE SCOOP:
The food here is delicious. We had the brisket and the baby back ribs, which were great. A side of coleslaw and potato salad, and a banana pudding for dessert. Make sure to order the pudding! The staff was friendly, the place was casual with great outdoor seating. The BBQ sauce was definitely tasty.

THE POOP:
No alcohol is served (yet, they say), they did run out of some items (fortunately none that we wanted to order) and I wished they had a few more side dishes to offer. You eat on thick butcher paper (no plates), which worked fine for us, but definitely count this place as casual.

THE RECOMMENDATION:
We would definitely stay here again.

Visiting from California and was looking for beef ribs.   Arrived an hour before closing and scored a full rack of beef ribs to go.  The staff was very friendly and also gave us samples of the brisket.

The ribs were great and the sauce was awesome.  Great experience and will return again.

I wrote this review months ago, but still wanted to post.  Unfortunately this location has closed --- SOOOO sad.

My husband and I eat here at least once a week.  Consistently delicious.  Must try:  chop BBQ, spare ribs, and turkey.  I recommend getting a 1/4 lb of a couple different meats because it is too hard to choose a favorite.
We had catering from them. The brisket was probably some of the best brisket that I've ever had.
OMG!!!!!   Knowing what real Texas bbq taste like I was skeptical but this really hit the mark, it's so frkn good....  almost just like my daddy's.

Needed a place for lunch the first time I was in the area.. Went there for lunch and dinner both days and now I'm back and made this account just for this place.. Best pulled pork ever and the employees are very nice. Will be going here all 3 days I'm here.
This is the best!  Their beef brisket is excellent along with every thing else. Also love the creamed corn.
Fantastic!!! Rolled into Texas BBQ house 5 mins before closing and owner welcomed us to place any order. Gave us samples of anything we wanted to try and a special side of his brisket. Delicious.

Let me start off by saying it's hard to impress me with BBQ as I run the BBQ Club here in Arizona for a living.

That being said, this place is one of the best I have ever had.  Their Moist Brisket is nothing short of amazing, certainly the BEST Brisket I have ever had at a Restaurant.

Their Pork Loin & Sausage are also fantastic.  I'm still working on the rest of the menu.  I will post up more once I sample all of it.

I love their Cream Corn Side as well as their Banana Pudding, I could just go there and order those all day.

This Restaurant is one of the top BBQ Restaurants here in the Phoenix area and I highly recommend everyone stop in & try them out.  I know they are working on opening up another one in South Scottsdale and I'm excited for that one as I live close to where it will be.

Stop in, tell them you read the AZBarbeque review & post up your thoughts.

Hands down the best BBQ in the greater Phoenix area. That's right. I said greater Phoenix area. Because it is better than Rudy's (which I heard is getting a location in Chandler). How could I make such a huge statement? How dare I? Because I am from Texas. I know good down home service and food and this is it. Plus my fiance is a BBQ snob (also from Texas). He takes it very seriously (it's a little funny but cute). 

We got the brisket and the pork ribs with sides of creamed corn and beans. So good. Top it off with Shiner and I was in heaven. Seriously, I felt like a kid again just after finishing a long trail ride (minus the Shiner, of course). We also got to taste the jalapeno sausage and it was delicious. 

I can't wait to go back and try every single thing on this menu. The service was the best in the city. THIS is what good service looks like, Phoenix!! Y'all don't even know!!

Not sure how to rate this place.  We went for dinner at 5PM this past Saturday and the place was locked up.  Checked their facebook page thinking maybe there was an entry of closure for whatever reason.  They HAD been on vacation but returned Sep 2....didn't work out this time around.  Next time, I guess we have to call ahead.  Very odd.
Best bbq in town (I am a Texan). Only downside is that half the times I go they are either sold out of meat or closed for the day to a catered event elsewhere.

I don't know what to say about this place...it's just...ah.  I forget things, you know.  My friends say that it's starting to really concern them and they've urged me to see a doctor about it, but I don't know...doctors are just...I don't know.  I really don't.

Anyway this place was great.

Absolutely the best brisket in phoenix. I should know as I've tried them all. I stop here every time I'm in the area. 
I'll often get the Texas poboi sandwich for lunch. It's a full pound of meat! 1/3 brisket , 1/3 pulled pork, 1/3 smoked sausage. Yummy.. 
The restaurant is usually busy, especially during lunch time. But the que moves quickly. The staff are friendly, and everything is always clean.
Make sure your good and hungry when you try this place..

Great bbq, especially the brisket and the turkey!  Beware of the hot sauce, as it has some real zing to it.  I only had to go several times, so I can't comment on the dine in experience.  Great lunch to grab for a group at work.
The brisket blew my mind.While I am no expert,I did grow up in Texas and good bar b q was a regular thing for me growing up.That brisket reminds me of home.

Wow.  My sister was in town from San Antonio and I thought this would be a perfect time to put this place to the test.  My colleagues have been talking about it for months and it did not disappoint.  Her and I consider ourselves foodies and can be tough customers, but Texas BBQ House hit a home run.

PULLED PORK, PULLED PORK, PULLED PORK!!!!!!

This was my second visit here, the first time we got a sampler platter and that was good. But he second time we got the poboy, and that was out of this world incredible!  With excellent customer service and great food, we will definitely be back.

This place is friendly, fast and delicious. 
I am a huge fan of lil miss BBQ and go there often, but the line is sometimes something I can not deal with. This place is very close to as good, reasonably priced an now on my list of favorites.
Awesome great love this place great service everything is decisions highly recommend please go here you will not regret it
With out a doubt the most tender, moist and tasty brisket I have had since I left Houston. They offered samples of the meat before we ordered and to me that is pride in your product!

Have been driving past this place almost everyday since moving here four months ago.  Stopped by tonight to give it a try.... Yum!  If you've ever had good Texas Barbecue, and have been missing it, this place more than satisfies... Wow!

Simple great BBQ. Haven't been disappointed yet.

Prefer this place much more than Joe's Real BBQ.

The food here is amazing. It's not the cheapest but absolutely worth the price. It was my first time visiting so I was able to try a fairly good size slice of brisket for free. I ended up getting the Texas Po boy filled with brisket, pulled pork and sausage. It was absolutely amazing and a huge sandwich I almost wasn't able to finish. There is a nice walk up condiment bar and the staff is nothing less than friendly and  enthusiastic. Only complaint is they don't sell alcohol so don't plan on having a beer with your BBQ. Will definitely be going back.

My girlfriend, from Texas, knows her BBQ well, and she gave this place 5 stars. I have to agree. Now I've only had "real" Texas BBQ once before, but this place was just amazing. The flavors....oh the flavors. Very clean and comfortable place. The owners are really nice, and they have college football on all the time, you have to love that. Please try....you will go back.

Seriously the best BBQ I have had since moving to Phoenix from Austin 8 years ago. I've been there twice in the past two weeks and I can't get enough! Now if only someone could open a kolache shop....
I had the pulled pork sliders and they were awesome. A little bit of a line and parking was tough but it was worth it. Really great barbecue.

This place is awesome!  Very no frills, but all that energy goes into the meats.  We tried the brisket, the pork loin, the ribs, and the jalapeno sausage...all served in a soda basket on butcher paper.  The brisket and the ribs were my favorite, but they were ALL very tasty, moist, and cooked with some of the best rub we've had anywhere.  They were hoppin for a Tuesday night, so it looks like word has spread.  The only so so thing was the potato salad, tasted storebought, will get the cole slaw next time.  The pecan pie was a great finish. We WILL be going back. This spot is definitely a new favorite!!!
The best BBQ ever. I always get the moist brisket and Mac n cheese. The sauce is delicious and if you want dessert I suggest the banana pudding.

If you like BBQ then visiting this place will be a religious experience. Ribs, smoked turkey, links, chicken, are the best in Phoenix. The brisket is the best I've ever had anywhere. If you like BBQ then get there now!

Texas BBQ House was the first to bring real Texas style BBQ to Arizona and on good days they do it very very well.

The problem is that they are not consistent - some days they are amazing, other days they are barely edible.

If you get lucky and catch them on a good day, their moist brisket is awesome and their pork ribs are amazingly awesome.

It took 15 f***in' years for real barbecue to make it to Phoenix. I've suffered the chains and the boiled gray attrocities that some chumps around town kiss with fire and then slather in spicy ketchup. Thank you guys. The meat eats rock and service is good 'ol, unmistakable Texan hospitality. It was good food made by people in a good mood, which makes it taste and feel that much better.

Shiner available but no Lone Star. All good. Also, I could use some type of green veg next time, even if it is fried. Perhaps some green beans with bacon and onion?

P.S. I'm a born and raised Texan. If you don't like that, **** you. I'm kidding. Bring on the jokes. Let's see what you got or if you just serve up the clichés you've heard in movies.
Awesome brisket!! The sauce is amazing too!  Sadly this place is on my drive home. I have to force myself not to stop.

Had lunch here with for a business meeting after having a yearning for BBQ for a week or so.  Ambiance was nice. Staff were friendly. First time so they offered samples, which was helpful. I ended up trying the beef brisket with a side of the regular smoked sausage. Flavors were good; all the meats are smoked so served "dry."I really liked the home-made BBQ sauce on the side ... Thick, nice flavors, not too sweet. The outside patio was small but pleasant with picnic table seating. Definitely a plus for Phoenix in the fall/winter/spring months. All in all, a pleasant experience.

Best BBQ place in town, hands down. I don't travel anywhere else but here now. The guys in the back are great and friendly and the food is excellent. The different cuts help with my mood, want lean you can get it, want moist you can get it, want extra fat you can get it. Service is quick and you are in and out with excellent food!
F-. Food is way overpriced and its mediocre at best. You can get better bang for your buck at a steak house.

I don't ever write reviews but sometimes a place is so great you just have to. Been all over Texas having BBQ. To me Texas is the only place to get real BBQ. Texas BBQ House is the bomb. Real deal awesome Texas BBQ. Brisket was AMAZING!!!! Anybody who want the deal go here.

I was told this was the best place in Phoenix for BBQ by a friend and they were not lying! I came in for lunch today (4/24/2014) and had the Texas Po'Boy sandwich and potato salad on the side. The sausage, brisket, and I believe pork loin in the Po'Boy were tender and excellently prepared. If you come in hungry, the Po'Boy is definitely more than enough to satisfy that hunger as it is BIG. This is a true BBQ house and a definite 5 star place!

I have been looking for a replacement for Rudy's BBQ in Albuquerque ever since I moved to Phoenix 8 years ago. Texas BBQ House opened up just down the road from me and thank God it did. It may not be quite as good as Rudy's, but it is pretty close. 

I usually tend to stick to the lean brisket and turkey  to keep the fat and calories down and I enjoy both cuts very much. Some might not think they have enough flavor or juicyness. If so, try the moist brisket and the pork ribs. More fat and calories, but definitely more flavor. 

Everything is served in the traditional Texas style, on butcher paper. Your tray is an old soda crate, and your plate is a clean sheet of butcher paper. The staff will give you a few slices of white bread based on the amount of meat you purchased. More meat, more bread.  You grab the three common sides, pickles, onions, and pickled jalapenos seperately  and the BBQ sauce is at the table. 

If you want to purchase other sides, such as beans, cole slaw, etc, it is all there in the true Texas fashion. I recommend the creamed corn and the pinto beans. 

As I said before, I have definitely had better Texas style BBQ in NM and Texas, but this place holds it own. My only real issue is I wish they would make a spicier bbq sauce. 

I eat here about once a week, so the place definitely deserves a high rating.

I'm a Texas girl born and raised and I know good BBQ when I taste it. If you're not a Texan, you may not be aware of how serious BBQ skill claims are. Well, I'll tell you, its' pretty darn serious. So much so, that even though I haven't eaten meat in several years, I did the unthinkable.

My husband and I were walking around Old Scottsdale while on a trip from Colorado and saw the Texas BBQ House and decided to have lunch there to see if it lived up to its name. We walked up to the counter where we were greeted with the friendly staff offering samples of any kind of meat on the menu. 

While normally I would just opt for vegetarian sides, I became so distracted by the divine aroma coming from the pit, that I think it hypnotized me into wanting a sample. Now a good bbq place will always have at least 2 kinds of brisket - lean and moist. They had a 3rd kind which was cutter's choice. My husband sampled the moist brisket and was oohing and awing that it made me want to see for myself so I sampled the lean brisket. And yes, I heard a choir of angels sing as it melted in my mouth. The clouds parted and heaven's light shone upon that delicious piece of brisket. Just the right flavor of smokiness, definitely lean, I'd have to say the best brisket I've had anywhere, that includes the great state of Texas. To my husband's (and my) surprise, I asked for half a pound and began to check for the other Texas obligatory staples that are absolutely necessary. 

BBQ Sauce - check, they have two - original and spicy, both yummy - though I liked the spicy better. Sliced white bread - check... no nut-covered, artisan bread thank you, just plain, sliced white bread. Potato salad, beans, cole-slaw, creamed corn, check - the creamed corn was the best I've tasted, ever. I can eat an entire soup pot of that. Sweet tea, oh yes. I didn't even have to add more sugar. Fixins - check - which if you don't know, include, pickles, onions and jalepenos. These are a must. 

AND... the meat and bread was served on butcher paper atop Pepsi crates! Texas BBQ indeed. 

This is not to say that I am a converted vegetarian and now a meat eater. I've decided that the only time I'll eat meat is the next time I'm in Scottsdale, at Texas BBQ House - which a trip to AZ just for the brisket would totally be worth it.

Today it would have been nice if they would have posted either on their web site or on Yelp, they were closed for vacation before I drove out there from North Phoenix.  Disappointment.  I think the sign stated they are closed until 9-8-2017.

I've just now come down from the high that Brooks' Place gave me eating brisket in FOR REAL ACTUAL TEXAS (see the review I made just previous to this one), so I actually went searching for a place close to home that laid claim to Texas fame. I was excited to find the Texas BBQ House with such glowing reviews. It's good, it really is. Unfortunately, it ain't quite the same. 

Naturally I had the brisket. I mean, it *is* the "Texas"  BBQ House, right? It was good. It was tender, it was smoky, it was probably on par with the best I've had in Phoenix (which was Bobby-Q by the way, but that was a long time ago). The problem is, it didn't blow my mind, and as I mentioned, I recently had my mind blown by brisket in Texas. Maybe that isn't fair, I don't know. It is what it is. 

So then what we have here is basically "competent," and "at least as good as anything similar you'll find elsewhere in Phoenix," which seems like faint praise. But brisket is hard. I make my own (and I'm no slouch myself) so I know exactly how hard it is. So really, just to say it's as good as I've found in Phoenix is pretty high praise. 

The real problem is, little else caught my fancy. I had cole slaw on the side. It was unremarkable - could have been bought at Costco. They have one sauce, it tastes like... nothing. Like Kraft. Boring and unremarkable - and no spicy option. 

Add to this that my *first* experience at TBBQH consisted of being turned away by a sign at the door saying "SOLD OUT" (at 4PM) and well, you basically get a three-star "average" review from me.

I really prefer my competent brisket to be served with mind-blowing sides and sauce(s). Alternatively, you could serve me mind-blowing brisket and merely competent sides and sauce(s) and maybe you'd get up to four stars. Either way, that's not what I got here.

Prices were OK, I suppose, $14 for a half pound of brisket, a couple ounces of cole slaw and a drink. Beef ain't cheap these days, that's for sure.

I do like the way they serve their wares - real deal Texas. Butcher paper, white bread. Plastic forks and knives. The place looks like a dive and is in a crap neighborhood, and honestly, that's all as it should be.

Another great meal - cutter's choice brisket, a couple of sausage links, and the pulled pork for a group to share. Along with some excellent coleslaw and potato salad.

We appreciate that they don't want food to go to waste at the end of the evening, but we often need to make some substitutions on what we order if we get there after 6 pm. Last night we didn't get there soon enough, and the creamed corn was sold out. Other times it has been the regular sausage links.

Fortunately the other choices are excellent too - we just have to make those minor adjustments, and have a back up plan of what will take the place of the item that has sold out.

This is by far the best BBQ we have found, and we are fortunate to have it in the South Mountain area.

Food was delish

two orders of ribs = 3 Ribs

thats TWO ORDERS??????????

Two times this month we have had them cater to our office. This is at my guys request. They love it. Food is always good always fresh and the help is great. They deliver they setup; you will love their catering service. Give them a try you'll be glad you did.

Oh my goodness this is some of the best barbecue I have had in a long long time.  Real Texas style. Pork ribs falling off the bone and brisket melting in my mouth. 
I will definitely have to come back here again. Did I forget to mention the pecan pie?

Been here quite a few times. Among the Best BBQ in phoenix! I always get there poboy sandwich $12.99. It can get busy in afternoon's on weekdays. Try to get in early for easy parking. 

There is a living social deal , but that's not valid for daily specials or poboy sandwich. IMO deal is not worth it.
A hidden gem. It's excellent every time we go. The brisket is the best I've ever had. The desserts are to die for. The sides are down-home cookin' at it's finest. I wish their hours were extended!
Amazing brisket and Mac n Cheese!! The spicy BBQ sauce is killer!

Best BBQ Restaurant in the Phoenix area! Amazing brisket, ribs, and pulled pork. All the sides are exceptional. My favorites are the beans and their macaroni and cheese. Leave room for their banana pudding!

Hands down the best BBQ I've ever had.  I'm not from the area and will be back whenever my travels bring me to Phoenix.  The moist brisket was a religious experience, the ribs were amazing, jalapeño sausage was perfect and the cole slaw was just right.  I can't wait to return.
Good food. They know they run out and they are usually always busy. How about being smart and making more food and hiring a couple more staff. We know you aren't hurting for the money.

This place is great.  It's a small place but they are very friendly and offer up samples if you want to try one of the meats.  They cut the meat right behind the counter and it is always great.  I have had the brisket, pulled pork and the sausage and they were all great,  I really like the sauces as well, although the spice sauce definitely has a kick.

B B Q started here!  The chef  knows how to cook!  New York steak medium rare was YEAAAAAAA BUDDY good!!


-Cheers-.

Best BBQ I've ever had.......
I was asked to pick up food here for a work colleague , and 24 hours later have already been back.  I have my own smoker, and am a very good cook, but I, nor any other place I've ever been to, comes close to this.  The brisket fell apart when I picked it .  No knife required,or sauce IMHO.  The cole slaw was some of the best I've had as well.  Took some home to  my family and there was a fight over it.  
This is by far, the best BBQ in AZ.

Hands down the best brisket I've had in Arizona.
The meat is tender and moist in all the right places.
There online ordering is quick (unless you use the famished app which has failed to work once since I tried using it). Customer service is great and they always have a smile and greet you when you walk in. Keep up the good work!

Update:
I have used their famished app attempting to get food and the majority of the time orders are not accepted. I got emailed a coupon by them to use with the app! The app failed and I went in and showed them it failed and I wasn't allowed to use the coupon on the app again saying I already redeemed it. They refused to give me the discount! Bad customer service. Their food is amazing but get it together with your online ordering and don't send coupons to customers then refuse to accept them.

Appears to be a family run joint.  BBQ is solid.  I had brisket w a little fat, side of coleslaw, and a roll.  Made myself a tall sandy for lunch by adding pickles and a sliced pepper (hot as hell).

Service is great.  Appears one of the kids works the floor, and he's sharp as a tack cleaning up after customers.  Even offered to run down a drink refill for me.  

Great booths to sit in, tvs playing sports, comfortable covered outdoor patio, etc.  

Only drawback was this big banner on the side wall that read, "You're in (Dallas) Cowboy Country."  Eh, I hate the Dallas Cowboys, but I didn't see Tony Romo or Jerry Jones, so I'll come back for the BBQ.
Texas BBQ House is the real deal! Awesome food. Highly recommended.

went in today 2/12/13 had ordered mac n cheese, cutters choice brisket, pulled pork, and pork spare ribs. 

First and for most I went in around 1050-11am and didn't eat until just after 1130 since I was waiting for my wife to go on her lunch break (shes a teacher in the area).

mac n cheese: warm and filling with a great flavor not to much of anything though i could have used a little more pepper in mine that is a personal preference.

Cutters choice: With a nice thick smoke ring and a nice flavor profile the cut melted in my mouth. my wife and I made it into sandwiches and with a small amount of there spicy BBQ sauce I devoured this great meat.

pork spare ribs: now let me start off by saying that Ribs are my personal choice in choosing a meat to smoke and i like mine sweet. But I had to keep in my mind open. The meat had no pull which is something to look for in a good rib. The ribs had a good flavor with the major flavor in mine seemed to be pepper but man let me tell you that these were on point. If you understand Texas BBQ you know that it rarely comes with a BBQ sauce which was the case her and honestly it didn't need it though some may say it did. 

At this point in our meal I was full and was unable to get and of the pulled pork but my wife said she enjoyed it with just a little of the original BBQ sauce. 

I highly recommend this place i know i will be back as long as they maintain the Q.

David Pepiton
31bravo
AZ BBQ member


PS i will update my review when i have some more of the different cuts of meat.

Hot damn this BBQ is no joke. Don't let the area turn you away, it's 100% worth the drive. The moist brisket is absolutely incredible and not to be missed. My last visit I ordered the Po Boy sandwich and it was outstanding. A third pound each of sausage, pulled pork, and cutters choice brisket, all for only $10 and unbelievably delicious.

Staff is awesome and for what you're getting it's worth the price. Definitely making Texas BBQ House a weekly tradition.

Texas BBQ House catered my daughters wedding last  week & they did an excellent job. We got so many people saying how great the food was. We had it buffet style so there were different items to choose from....everything was delicious! They're staff was so great & friendly. I highly recommend their restaurant or using them to cater your event!! Thanks Mike, you & your staff are awesome!

I am from Arkansas and have always been of the mind set that you can't get great BBQ outside of the mid-south or my own backyard smoker. This myth has been disspelled by the Texas BBQ House. Their pork ribs were tender and juicy. The brisket was outstanding. Even though it has a rustic looking exterior it was very clean and the entire staff was extremely friendly. I have already told several friends and plan on using their catering service for the staff at my work. Beware the samples-you'll want to buy everything on the menu :) .

This place was soooo good! Do not let the outside fool you...it is not what you would expect on the outside but the inside is just what you would expect a BBQ place to look like. Today was our first time trying it and the girl at the counter was very nice and offered us samples of the brisket. The meat was so good and tender. I am so happy we found this place down here in this area!.

Great low key spot!  We loved our food here.  To be honest this is where we ended up after Little Miss was sold out BUT we were very happy!  The couple that ran the place were very sociable and we actually talked for some time.  My partner in crime for the week was visiting from Florida and we ended up giving the guy and his fiancé a bunch of recommendations for his trip down that way soon; so I hope it all works out! The pulled pork sandwiches (with) coleslaw that we got were wonderful and our bellies were full!  Sweet tea was perfect and we had a side of potato salad which is made how I am used to, being from NC, so I loved it!  We would definitely go back here!
Excellent brisket, very juicy and tasty, and reasonably priced.  Just removing a star because on Yelp it looked like they serve beer (they don't).  I'd definitely come again

The BEST BBQ in Phoenix! Shared the sampler platter with friends, everything was done right! Brisket and ribs were to die for...potato salad and green beans were perfect. I will be back on a regular basis!

It's wonderful to once again have excellent BBQ in South Phoenix :-D

We had the moist brisket, sausage, sweet corn, and pinto beans.  The brisket had a wonderful mild flavor and doesn't need sauce unless you want a bolder flavor.  The sausage was delicious and made a great sandwich in the white bread with onions and sauce.  The corn and beans were delicious!

The setting is cozy and casual and the staff were great.  One minor complaint was that the unsweetened tea was over-brewed to the point of being bitter.  That aside, we loved it and we'll be back!

The jury has deliberated and the verdict is in....a easy five stars people. This is just good que!  That's it people, if you're reading this review stop...... go and order food and then go ahead and drop five stars in your review. 

The place in South Phoenix next to a beauty shop. It may not be easy on the eyes  driving up and looking at the exterior; the inside isn't must better, however, it is clean.   

The people working here are down to earth, you'll hear good ole country music playing in the background and you can count on seeing NFL network playing on at least one TV.  They serve your food in Pepsi and Coke creates, don't go looking for plates cause all you'll find is ole fashion wax paper. 

If you don't like this place I would like to understand what makes you rise to the level of nirvana.   

The parking lot is..... the first word that comes to mind that's smaller than "tiny". I would say parking is intimate but that's the adjective.

Grew up in San Antonio and Austin. Have traveled extensively and sampled BBQ all over the country. The term Texas-style means beef, first. Period. And good smoke, and that ain't mesquite. Oak is king. These guys have changed the face of Phoenician BBQ forever. It's a shame that the Scottsdale location was touched by ... well, Scottsdale. Friggin morons. If you have not been here, you need to go down to 24th and E. Roeser and try it. Hands down the best Q in the area, including Cave Creek. The guys are FROM Texas and they know the whats, wheres and hows of Bar-B-Que. 

And for those "the meal in a carton on butcher paper" snobs who think that such is declasse, please, do me a favor... Head on down to Austin or, better yet, Lockhart. Stand at the front of the line at Stubbs or Black's or Kruez Market and loudly proclaim your thoughts as a BBQ aficionado. Just let me know when you are heading down so I can hang out and watch the ensuing festivities. Freud said it best: BBQ and being horrifically anally-retentive is ALL about your unfulfilled dreams of your Auntie Ma. Or, shut up and grow up ya infantile gomers...

Going to Texas BBQ was a last minute decision in an unfamiliar area after meeting a client over the. I left the meeting feeling really hungry, so I got on to Yelp to find a place to eat. After seeing so many 5 star reviews, I had to check it out. Not only were the staff nice, but the food was amazing. We had the ribs, brisket, pulled pork, jalapeño sausage, green beans and coleslaw. I have never had such tender brisket or tasty ribs. It is worth checking out. I will definitely be back.

The best part of this place might not even be the stellar bbq. It might be the folks who run it. Great people. Mike is very gracious with his time and bbq. I never miss an opportunity to stop by. 
I take my bbq seriously and this beats every other place in town. Just call ahead or get there early. That moist brisket goes fast. Especially if I'm there.

drove past and saw the sign, and after having spent several years in Texas, had to try this place -- and was extremely impressed. I had the moist brisket, and even without sauce, it was awesome. Nice pink smoke ring, moist and tasty. They even had the sides of dill pickles, jalapenos, and onions -- yum!

I also had the cole slaw, and it was very good as well.

I definitely want to go back and try the hot links and the turkey -- but both my friend and I really enjoyed our first (of many to come) visits.

The first thing I noticed here is that the wait time wasn't bad at all, but I came early for lunch on a weekday.

I tried to brisket and the ribs. The brisket was really, really good. 5 stars by itself. The ribs were kind of touch and chewy, and I wouldn't bother with them again. The sides were pretty dang good as well.

I'll definitely come here again when I want some good brisket and don't want to wait in line for 45 minutes at the other place I like to go.
Did this place close? 1pm on a Sat and no sign of life. All the roll downs were closed too.
Amazing brisket. Best i have had in years!  Wonderful staff, friendly service. Don't judge by the outside, get in there, son!

Visited Texas BBQ House for lunch after hearing reviews that it rivaled one of my favorite BBQ joints in Phoenix, so I wanted to check it out. Anything with Texas in the name has my intrigue when it comes to BBQ

First of all, you get $3 off for checking in to Yelp which is a huge plus in my book. Great move by the owner. The parking is a little sparse, but we managed to get a good spot with minimal line. They have a great selection of BBQ from both fatty and lean brisket, to their signature sandwich the Texas Po Boy. The prices were consistent with other BBQ joints.

I ordered the Texas Po Boy because it covered the main types of food you're looking for: brisket, pulled pork and sausage. This sandwich is huge and comes with plenty of meat. I'd suggest it if you're coming hungry and ready to eat. It was quite tasty for every bite. The down side for me was that the sausage tended to overpower the other meats, which makes sense due to the strength of sausage flavor as a whole. I also wish they had their own BBQ sauce selection for customers. I was not a fan of the BBQ sauce they put on the sandwich for you. I would have liked to add my own, and had options like you do at other places. If you're getting brisket, I would recommend getting the lean. My friend had the "moist" brisket and it had a little too much fat on it. That was coming from a guy who loves fatty brisket.

All in all, it was a good BBQ experience and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for good BBQ and not in the mood to stand in line for a long time. I would definitely return when in the area.

We came at around 4pm, all they had left was 1 order of ribs,  1 order of pulled pork, turkey & sausage. We were really looking forward to brisket, but we decided to try it anyway. All the food we got was excellent!! Kids loved the sausage & mac n cheese. Hubby loved his ribs & coleslaw. I quite enjoyed my pulled pork & pinto beans- spicy! Pepsi products for drinks with Big Red! Decent prices for fresh & authentic Texas BBQ.

Best BBQ I have had probably ever. I got the Texas Po Boy which is a 1lb sandwich for $13 that uncles a 1/3 lb of each brisket, sausage and pulled pork. Unfortunately they were out of pulled pork but doubled up the brisket instead. I split it with a carnivorous boyfriend and we were both happy. The meat is moist and flavorful. BBQ sauces were a delightful condiment, not overpowering. 
Soft drinks, takes cards. Nice cold inside and clean tables. Service was amazing and provided generous portions. 
Can't ask for more and will be back.

The good: The creamed corn side.  A. Mazing.  The service...very friendly.

The so-so: The brisket that's mixed with sauce was very lacking in flavor.  The sliced brisket was much better, but had lots of fat in it, which I don't like (some may).  There were 2 sauces, didn't really care for either of them, both are pretty spicy (I like spicy, but just FYI for those who don't).  

The bad: The bread they serve the meat on is like wonderbread.  

I probably will not go back, but 3 of the 4 men (my co-workers) whom I've gone with have all been back multiple times.

I love this place! It's delicious. The people that work there are super friendly and let you sample if you aren't sure what to order. Make sure to stop by earlier in the day because at the end of the day they don't have every menu item- I can understand why.

It's always a good idea to wait a few hours before writing a review. I had six pork ribs, half a smoked sauage and a small side of green beans. Cost with small beverage slightly over $22. The food tasted great with the ribs looking cooked to perfection, BUT a few hours later...I could not get off the toilet. I don't know if they used MSG in the food or what, but it doesn't matter how good the food tastes going down if it gives you "Montezuma's Revenge" later! I was going to give it 4 solid stars, subtracting a fifth star for boring sides and dilapidated seating, but I cannot say I'll be going back...except to my bathroom!
Amazing food! The briquette is one of the best I have ever had, and the po boy sandwich is phenomenal.

My wife was born and raised just outside Houston and I've traveled all over the country on business and in search of great food. I never thought I'd find a place that could even come close to The Salt Lick or The County Line in the Austin area, but folks, this is the real deal. These boys know how to whip up a batch of Texas best vittles this side of El Paso! Don't go gettin' all dressed up for this one, 'cuz you are going to be wearing (and bringing) some of this home! The down home atmosphere and Shiner Bock on ice is just the start, and the finish with some pecan pie makes it all come together at the end! Great place to take the family, friends and their families, too!

This place is horrible. I don't know why it has such good reviews...maybe I came on a bad day but the food was cold, the soda was watered down and the employees rude. Not to mention its way out of the way in a not so great area. 

If you are looking for good Texas style bbqB try Rudys or Alisons.
Great meat and perfect country feel at this place. Best pulled pork I've had in years! Definitely the place to go for some real BBQ

I found the meat, although tender, lacked seasoning.  It was very smokey, which I like, but a little more seasoning will push it to more stars.

It is a bit pricey as they charge by the pound.

If you're hankering for some real Texas BBQ on the Southside of town look no further. Albeit this place is smack dab in the ghetto but when you walk inside the atmosphere is very rodeo-ish.  The guys behind the counter are extremely friendly they even offer samples. MAKE SURE TO BRING CASH!!!! I hate it when restaurants make you pay cash, but it does keep the operating cost down for small business owners. On the bright side there is an ATM in the store so don't worry if you forget to bring cash. Let's get down to the star of the show; the MEAT! I had the Brisket and the Jalapeno Sausage both were served in meat paper not plates. The flavors were fully developed and easy to chew. For sides I had the Potato Salad which was standard and the Mac & Cheese which was nice and cheesy. It is a bit expensive but what good BBQ isn't. This place sells the items ala carte with the exception of the daily special. I will be back for more! Oh yeah, the BBQ sauce was served on the side and was a nice touch to all of the food

Best bbq I have had in phoenix HANDS DOWN! Moist brisket is the business! Ribs, chicken, jalapeño links, potato salad, Mac n cheese, topped with that spicy bbq sauce and pickles and jalapeños on the side! With all that amazingness AND a great friendly staff how could you go wrong? Thanks for making my stomach happy time and time again!

I love this place! I've been there for lunch several times. The BBQ doesn't even need BBQ Sauce. The sides are savory and delicious too! The Po Boy is awesome and the brisket is to die for. The staff is friendly and helpful. Try this place if you love BBQ!

Been wanting to try this place for awhile now but haven't had the chance and conveniently enough it's down the street from my house so it wasn't much of a drive. It was my first time and I ordered to go. The staff was friendly and the environment was good, only the parking lot is a small and tight but their food is worth it! Got two different kinds of ribs and cream corn soup and it was amazing! Definitely returning for ribs! Too bad they don't  deliver. It a hassle for me to take my 18 month old with me. If you haven't tried them already you should!!

A little of everything....juicy brisket, jalapeño sausage, pork ribs with a great pink smoke layer, green beans made the way I like em, creamy Mac and cheese and banana pudding like I had when I was a kid. My stomach feels like a ripe melon after putting all this down. 
I will have a nice nap on my flight back to Texas!
Awesome brisket and great, fast service. Will be coming back next time we have a hankering for bbq.

Texas BBQ House has the closest thing to Texas style brisket that I've found outside of Texas- props for offering it three ways, moist (fatty cut), cutter (chopped), or lean (why?), with my preference obviously being the first. Squirt on some of the "hot" bbq sauce (unless you're a pansy, then choose regular), add on a couple pickles, and it's heaven. White bread and red onions are optional. 

Heads up, even though the wait time isn't nearly as bad as Little Miss BBQ, if you don't go early they'll be out of a lot of things, most definitely the ribs. Even going in an hour after opening on a weekday, they were down to just brisket, pulled pork, and sausage. That said, I'm not much of a fan of pulled pork but theirs was really good: not too saucy or too sweet. Hot links were solid, too. 

Loved the atmosphere with picnic tables and outside seating, country music blasting, and three different football games playing. Really hit the spot when I was feeling homesick during the holidays. Opt for the $13 1-pound Texas PoBoy if you want a taste of everything!

Tried the Texas po' boy. It is freaking good. They allowed the swap out of the links for more pulled pork, that rules. Really some of the best pulled pork ever. The brisket was unbelievable too, and I don't even like brisket... Unfortunately they were out of beef ribs so I cant even imagine how good those are, will obviously be back to try them. Really nice people too. So far this place is better than Rudy's (pulled pork wise and sauce wise) I just wish they had baby backs instead of the St. Louis cut so cant really make a conclusion until those beef ribs have been tasted.

On our most recent trip to Phoenix, we set of goal of eating at a new BBQ place every day.  We avoided our regular haunt (Rudy's) and selected the new places from the best of Yelp and recommendations of local friends.  We found some winners and some losers, but Texas BBQ was by far the best of the bunch.

I had the Po' Boy special, which was a sausage topped with brisket and pulled pork, nearly a pound of meat.  All three meats were top notch, but the brisket was significantly better than most places.

My wife decided to go with the turkey breast and the creamed corn.  The breast was very moist with a nice smoke ring.  She also really liked their sauces, but her favorite of all was the creamed corn.  They make it from scratch, and it has a bit of Jalapeno for flavor.  I've never had a creamed corn that quite matched it.

The owner was very friendly and helpful, and allowed us to sample several other meats.  His young son was clearing tables, and was very polite and fun to chat with about the pit and the business.

I love walking in & smelling the smoky goodness. Friendly, fair prices and GOOD food!  I love barbecue and they do it right.  Quick service and I love the prime rib.  The spuds are back, smoked baked potato loaded with meat.  Their creamed corn is real, homemade and incredible.  I didn't like creamed corn before this but it's a whole new level.  Green beans are cooked with the brisket and well worth it.

You ever have the Experience, where you just appreciate goodoll A friendship feelin. My first time stepping into the restaurant. I was greeted with pure LOVE. This is a family owned business from Texas that takes wonderful care of their customers. Letting them know it was my first time they let me try the brisket. the inital sample had me hooked like a Giant 15LB catfish.. I wasnt going to leave this place.. I became a customer for life once I had my order! I CAN SAY TRUTHFULLY THIS IS THE BEST BBQ IN TOWN.. Since my first time I have been 3 times a week faithfully! I move to mesa so i am not able to visit as much but i can tell you... IF YOU WANT THE BEST BBQ IN TOWN. YOU COME HERE!! NO QUESTIONS ASKED!! BECAUSE WHEN YOU STEP IN HERE YOU WILL BE GREATED WITH LOVE EVERY TIME!!
First time here and we had the brisket and at Louis ribs.  Both were awesome!  It's nice to find a neighborhood bbq joint.  I'll definitely e coming back when I'm on this side of town again.

There's a nearby place with long lines. I thought that sounded good. I went there. Waited in line near garbage cans and bugs. Was told it would be an hour and a half. Decided to bolt for Texas BBQ House. Went in, was greeted by welcoming people. They told me the other place was all hype and that they would match their brisket against anyone's. They gave me a sample. I was sold. I'm no a fanboy or insider. Ignore the hype. Go to a place that appreciates you---and makes damn good 'cue.
Food was excellent.  Wish the portions were bigger for the price.

This place is the real deal.  The food here kicks serious ass.  I have been coming here since they opened.  I have tried most of the things on their menu and it all is good.  I might work up the courage to try the poboy someday.  That sandwhich is a beast.  Their brisket is super good. I usually get turkey though since I have to watch cholesterol.  I recommend this place and think you should try it.  Just a reminder there are different style of BBQ here now.  They are all different remember that.

This is the place if you LOVE brisket. They have 3 choices of fat content on your brisket, lean, cutters choice and moist. The cutters choice is in the middle between lean and moist. Look on the board for lunch specials. 

My favorites
$6.99  1/2 LBS of brisket moist
$2.09 small side of Texas cream corn
$1.99 Texas sweet tea

3 slices of white bread
1 Jalapeño
Spicy BBQ sauce

HEAVEN :)
Having lived in Texas for a decade, Texas BBQ House is as close to Texas BBQ that we have found in Arizona. Not a fancy place, however, you go there for the BBQ.  Texas BBQ House will not disappoint.

Just visiting Phoenix, and my wife found this place on Yelp since the barbecue place down the street had over an hour wait on a Saturday afternoon. Well, this place was fantastic! It's a hole in the wall, authentic Texas barbecue place with plenty of tables and no wait. You order at the counter and get your food right then, and because we were first timers they gave us free samples of their moist brisket, their specialty. It was dynamite and my wife ordered the brisket and got the hamburger bun to make herself an awesome sandwich.

I got the po boy sandwich, 1/3lb brisket, 1/3lb pulled pork, and 1/3 pound sausage (no bread). It was ridiculous! I liked the sausage, with mustard, but the other two were outta this world. I highly recommend this place.

My wife and shared the sides of cream corn and mac & cheese, both top notch. We couldn't be happier.
The best, had the moist cut, can't wait to try the others

I got there early so that I'd get sliced brisket, and it was really good. Choice of a lean or fat cut, and generous portions.  Nice condiment bar for pickles, onions, sauces, etc.

Basic dining area, but cool, clean, and comfortable.

I'll be back!

Do a better job running and planning your restaurant "son". Running out of food two hours before you close either means you have no idea what you are doing, don't give a s#!t about your customers, or you had just an incredibly larger amount of people than you've ever had.

Heard about inventory tracking much "son"? Heard about effective management "son"? Probably not as your answer to your customers is basically f#@k you.

I certainly won't be back to your dump.

These reviews make me wonder if my palate is off or whether this place is the closest anyone's ever had to southern bbq. 

Unfortunately, I can't say that I was a fan. All the elements for this to have been a home run were there - quaint location, screen patio door, the picnic tables. But, beyond that it just didn't land for me. 

I ordered the lunch special and got the brisket and potato salad. The potato salad was my fault. I was raised to know that you can't trust just anyone's potato salad. But, the brisket...it was way too fatty for me. 

Again, everyone seems to love it. But, if you were born below the Mason-Dixon line, proceed with caution.

My daughter and I stopped here for lunch about a month ago.  I had the brisket and it was really good.  I liked it so much that I took my wife back a couple of days later to eat again.   I will be coming back.

Food- I had the "cutter's choice cut" of 1/2lb of beef brisket, very nice smoke ring, good fall apart meat, bbq sauce there are two types, spicy and original both have a good sweet, bold taste. I also had full jalapeno link, not hat spicy, but certain yummy. The sides I had were cream corn and mac n cheese.  Cream corn was great had a little hint of sugar in it made it a little sweet tasting. The mac n cheese was nothing to brag about, the temp of mac n cheese was warm could be hotter. 

Service- The employees are very polite and will let you taste any product if you are not certain between fall off the bone chicken or nice smoked beef brisket. 

Environment- Felt like I was back in a Southern BBQ stop, small, cozy and loved the paper wrap as my plates (keeping it real, bravo)

**My only complaint is this, I have been back a few times and each time they are out of something. Last time it was the sausage links and they couldn't serve beer. Then I went back a month later and still out of sausage and no beer. Then I just went back on 10/15/2012 and they were out of Beef Brisket and Ribs. Come on! That is how you lose business by not keeping your product in stock. I had to go to Rudy's for beef brisket and I did not enough it.***

I will call before I go in again to see what products they are out off.

You seriously have to do yourself a favor and come here at least once a week. Its that good and then some. I just had the basic lunch special with the tri tip and it was beyond good. Im looking forward to trying the other cuts of meat.
Great Brisket and beans. Worth driving from Gilbert. Love the spicy BBQ sauce.

I can't wait to move to Phoenix. This place provided me with some of the BEST BBQ I've actually have ever had, and they only had so much on the menu, ran out of food early. I see why lol. I will say i think the Mac N Cheese needs a lot of work, and baked beans on the menu, but man those St. Louis styled ribs, and brisket. Mmmm Mmmm MMMMM!!!!
Food is amazing!! Get there when it opens to avoid long lines and product run outs. Brisket is out of this world. The banana pudding is amazing.

Prices are getting too high here. Now most meats are up to $9.29 per half pound. The lean brisket wasn't so lean this time, but hey they have hamburger buns now. The Texas twosome are overcharging by at least $2.50 per half pound now and even though it is still good, many more options are out there now for BBQ. Not worth the special trip anymore. Nothing lasts forever.

This place is just amazing!! I was recommended to it by my boss for my wedding food and let me just say it did not disappoint! The moment we did the food tasting, we knew this was the wedding food! The day of the wedding went off without a hitch, Mike and his staff were amazing and stayed the entire duration of the wedding to ensure everything went smoothly! All of my guests were raving about the food and how much they loved it! If you're thinking of having a party or wedding and need a caterer look no further, because not only is the food incredible, you really can't beat the price either!! Thank you Mike and Texas Bbq house for helping to make our wedding so amazing!!

First time here and was happily surprised. The brisket was mouthwatering and the coleslaw was perfect too. Definitely get the banana pudding to finish off! Can't wait to come back next time I'm on the side of town.
The brisket here is fantastic - moist, tender, delicious - and they sell out sometimes so don't delay.  The staff is always friendly and pleasant.  This place is a win!

I love TX BBQ and always go out of my way to find it. This was my second visit here. The first was with my wife and friends. Nice little restaurant that reminds me of what we would get along the train tracks in the poorer areas of TX.

Menu has your basic items that you would expect at a BBQ joint. The meats are all served by the pound and you can get as much or as little as you want. They also have several side dishes that go great with the Q. The Texas Cream Corn was a treat.

Normally get the Brisket and some Jalapeno Sausage. They have a small area off to the side with onions, pickles, jalapenos and some hot sauces. There are two different house sauces that they make and serve. One is mild and the other hotter.

Food is pretty good but not super great. My Brisket and Sausage seemed to be at room temperature and not very warm. The Sausage was dry and could of had more fat in it. The white bread was not very fresh and tasted like it had been sitting out too long.

Be careful where you sit down. I tried one of the red booths and about killed myself. Apparently the springs are shot and you end up lower than your body was expecting. Play it safe and go with the chair.

Definitely better than a lot of the sweeter styles that are offered around town. Give them a try and see what you think. Located south of the river in an area of town that could use some urban renewal. SMOKIN A-OK!

3.25 STARS
Excellent BBQ. Probably the best I've had in Arizona.  I had the moist smoked brisket and man it was good. The sauces were fantastic and the customer service was great!

Wow I was so impressed. My first time here was Friday for lunch. The brisket was the best I ever had. The portion size and quality for the price was the best part. Don't let the outside deter you from walking in. Staff is friendly and the food is outstanding.
Amazing!!! Great BBQ, great service and soda in a nice coke bottle was a beautiful touch. I highly recommend this place.

I so wanted to find a killer BBQ place close to home. After reading my fellow yelpers reviews, we tried the Texas BBQ House. Twice.

Was I being too picky? Am I expecting too much? Why didn't I love this place? The better question is... Why didn't I even like it?

1)  I don't find the flavor of the brisket to be genuinely smoked. Trust me, my neighbor knows how to smoke meats and fish, and his smoked meats blow this place away.

2) The brisket was lukewarm, not hot. Twice. 

2) It wasn't the experience that you say "OMG, I LOVE this". It was just okay.

3) Parking is a pain in the ass unless you're coming south on Scottsdale Road and can park in front of the restaurant...there are only a few parking spaces. IF there was fabulous BBQ inside, I wouldn't mind a walk, but there isn't.

4) Yes, the corn is good. I don't go to a BBQ establishment to eat corn. I go to Iowa to eat corn.

5) The beans are average, as is the potato salad. 

6) Their menu is getting smaller ("sold out" signs on sausages...already?).

7) They don't sell beer (yet).

Sorry, but I give them 4 months unless things get going on (in a true Texas direction).

First visit and the food was awesome.  Went with the Texas po boy, they ran out of pulled pork quickly.  I'll get there earlier next time.  The brisket was so most and tasty and the sausage links were great.  I'll be back for sure.
The moist brisket melts in your mouth! Make sure you dip it in the spicy sauce!!! True Texas BBQ!

Anyone comparing this place to Joes needs to have their head examined.  BBQ in the valley Texas BBQ, Pork On a Fork, Haps, The Pits Again, Q to U BBQ, and in that order (all are very good).  Joes is cafateria food with sauce on it.  Sorry east valley folk but you don't even travel out of your neighborhood let alone to other parts of the city.  Texas BBQ stands tall.  They also just added a BBQ tater which is very good as well.

The brisket was alright... Didn't want to wait in the long line at Little Miss BBQ, so I thought I'd give it a try. The meat was pretty tasty, but I was disappointed that they don't cut out the fat layer in the center of the brisket. At LMB, the cut it out and don't include it in weight of meat.
great food, loved the mac & cheese and the ribs..

Went here for lunch on a Friday with a groupon deal. The inside feels a little cramped when busy. Similar to Rudy's where you order meat by the pound. Not as wide of selection of meats, drinks. I wanted to try a sample of the Jalepeno links but they were out of those. The moist brisket was a bit too moist for my taste and the lean too dry. I tried the cutters choice which was supposed to be in the middle. Instead it was just half lean and half moist. The BBQ sauce was ok, nothing special. I would've preferred a spicy BBQ sauce as well. 

I ordered the beans and potato salad sides. Beans were just ok-- I thought both Rudy's and Joe's Real BBQ were better. Overall, not a bad place considering there is nothing comparable in old town--but I doubt I'd come back unless I had a strong craving for BBQ.

I am not a meat eater but this place was amazing. Got a 1 pound sandwich that had brisket, sausage and pulled pork. Amazing. They had their own spiced BBQ sauce and hot sauce. Would recommend to go hungry and possibly skip a meal after this place.
My husband is a BBQ junkie, me not so much... until now. Loved the brisket, and jalapeño sausage. The mac&cheese and creamed corn are also pretty good. My hubby is also a fan

Amazing BBQ went for the first time today and can't wait to go back!! Briscuit was like prime rib it was that falling apart good! Macaroni and Cheese was yummy and the sweet tea was perfect! Small place but amazing food

Was in town for business and decided to grab some food before my flight. Decide on this little BBQ joint because it was near and the photos looked good. 

I met with a friendly waitress who took my order at the front counter. It was a great experience. They cut your meat to order. It was quick and easy. My meal was served on a huge serving platter along with pickled onions and jalapeño. 

The ribs had a bit of a unique flavor. It was a dry rub which was cool but the flavor was something I had to get used to. I also order the fatty brisket and man was it good! So moist and flavorful. 

I'd recommend it!

I was going to eat here for my first time. I had read other reviews about the food and decided to try it out. Guess what?!!! The door was locked and a hand written sign was taped to the front door stating they were SOLD OUT. Keep in mind this was a Thursday at 5pm. How can they be sold out. How can a restaurant expect to be successful if they are out of food. I guess I won't go here at all. By the way I went to Rudy's Barbecue in Chandler...the food and service was great.

This place is quick and fantastic. Brisket is tender and very flavorful! Best I've had. 
Jalapeño sausage is awesome! Very friendly and a nice down home joint. Only in town for a couple of weeks, We will be back!
Great Staff, fantastic BBQ.  The Sweet Tea is fresh, and the sides such as the mac and cheese and the creamed corn is almost worth going for... just for that.

Amazing food! I had a beef rib , like the one that you see on the opening of the Flinstones! It was huge, but above that it tasted amazing and was super tender! The staff was awesome as well, friendly and very helpful to a first timer. Definitely going back!

Parking is hit or miss - small lot, shared with another business. 

Service was cordial. They offered a Yelp special- $3 off order. 

I got the Slider Special (3 pulled pork sliders, 1 small side, and a drink). The side of Mac n Cheese was very cheesy & had a touch of pepper. The sandwiches were very good... Pork came slathered in sauce, so take that for what it's worth. The fountain drink was very watered down. 

Overall, 4 out of 5 stars for efficient service, good pricing, and tasty food.

Couple things I want to get off my chest about this place.

The food itself is probably the best BBQ I've ever eaten to date, and I love BBQ in general. Pulled pork, brisket, and their bbq sauces both sweet and spicy ones are incredible. They deserve the recognition for their A+ flavor in BBQ. 

Now for the part that really annoys me...

- Since I've heard about the place 2 months ago, I've been there 8x (roughly 1x/week) because I work so close and love the food. 4 different times I've asked for their WiFi password, and they refuse to give it to me. I ask because I want to do some personal work on my laptop as I'm enjoying my meal. If they accommodated this, I'd easily go here probably 2x a week because of its location, great food, and it allows me to multitask. Since i spend on average $11 per visit, They're losing roughly $44/month of my business, not including the coworkers and friends I bring in with me because they can't accommodate a simple request, or set up a guest wifi.
Just enjoyed some of their brisket at the BBQ and beer fest. They were the best out of everyone.

To be honest, when we pulled up to this place I had my doubts.  It doesn't look like much on the outside - but I am so glad we stopped here.  This was AMAZING texas style BBQ.  

We arrived about 30 minutes before closing time and were greeted by two really helpful, friendly ladies asking if we've ever been before.  This strikes me as the type of place that has a lot of regulars because the food is SO GOOD. 
     They offered us a sample of the moist brisket (their specialty) and we knew we'd come to the right place! The best brisket I've ever had!  We ordered the po boy sandwich and two sides to share and it was plenty of food for my husband and I and our kiddo.  

I didn't try the sausage - but the pulled pork and brisket were amazing.  The BBQ sauce was tangy and the perfect compliment for both.... though the pulled pork could have been eaten alone because it already was really well seasoned.  The creamed corn and green beans were both great, flavorful and a good size for two people to share.  

Do yourself a favor and check this place out.  We will seek this place out the next time we're in the area!

(The continuing story of a yelp-loving couple seeking great locally owned joints, friendly service and a comfortable atmosphere for playing Magic the Gathering...)

NOTE: Do NOT confuse the little tiny kinda scary joint on Broadway and 27th ish street with this place.  They had a BIG sign that said "Teax BBQ" so I got confused.  We almost ordered but I just felt like this was NOT the place, so we left and I found it.  SOOOO glad we did!

Ok, so when I asked my husband for his rating of this place...he Stood Up and shot me a 5-Finger Salute.  *lol*  His new FAVORITE BBQ joint.  I must say, as a native Phoenician with no real experience with regional BBQs, I thought the food was top notch.  I just didn't have small kittens like my hubby...  :)

We ordered...
- Moist Beef Brisket (5/5 - yum!  I never knew beef could be so moist and flavorful WITHOUT any BBQ dripping over it!)
- Creamed Corn (DH said it was done right like his Grandma used to do it.  First time I have EVER eaten creamed corn...and liked it.  I will actually order it next time.)
- Mac & Cheese (Just good ole creamy mac & cheese.  Wanted way more...)
- Banana Pudding (VERY homemade.  Big chunks of banana in a creamy yummy pudding with 2 like Nila wafers and a big dollop of whipped cream.  We split and DH thought it was delish)
- Pecan Pie (pretty good as well.  Not life changing but solid)
- Sweet Teas (Diabetic Warning!  This sh_t it SO sweet, *I* did NOT get a refill!  I mean, it was totally yummy...but I started to feel my system balk at the suger overload....which means my southern DH thought it was made just right :P)

The white bread slices straight outta the bag struck me as hilarious but again, DH thought it was even more authentic due to it (and the country music, which he was digging.  Even I tapped a toe along).

The staff was super friendly and the small shop (seats outside as well though) was very comfortable for playing MTG.  They are located in an area some might consider "Sketchy" but I bet the building (which looks new or renovated and is lovely btw) was affordable for them!  PS:  Anyone in need of a relaxer or a fade - they are connected to a salon/barber shop which was nice looking and the barber had a line so good sign!

Seriously good eats.  Keep them in business.  I am NOT a big meat eater and I already know my next meal!   MTG Score: DH 3 / Me 0

This is probably the best place to get brisket in Arizona and in line quality-wise with the best places I've had in Texas. I do a lot of BBQ and eat a lot of BBQ and these guys clearly know what they're doing. The sausages (both the regular and hot) are great, creamed corn is awesome, and pecan pie is sooooo good. It's easily worth the trip down there. Just make sure you bring cash.
This place has the best brisket in town. Love the simple style of the place, focus is on the food. Terrific customer service. The creamed corn is my favorite side!

They don't worry about making it fancy, they concentrate on making it good. My boyfriend and our 2 friends did a sampler and tried everything. It was all delicious but my favorite was the BBQ Brisket and the BBQ Chop. There sides are delicious too and the banana pudding is D-LICIOUS! =) YUMMY!
The owner (or one of them) was there and was so friendly, helpful and entertaining. Don't let the area or the building scare you... this holds true to the fact that "the best food comes from mom and pop hole in the walls". 
The only thing I would change, is they hold back a bit on the spices in there rubs... and the BBQ sauce could be a bit better....
But all in all, great place and one of the best BBQ places in Arizona.

This place has the best brisket of all time! The moist is so juicy and delicious! I just throw some on fresh white bread with some pickles and sauce and I'm good to go. They also have delicious creamed corn and their pulled pork is delicious too! This is the one place that my husband and I can always agree on. You will never go wrong at Texas BBQ House -- just make sure you get there in time (especially on Fridays) cuz their BBQ goes fast!
Delicious BBQ, great customer service! The food is amazing! Their sliders are so tasty and their lunch specials are a fair price. I really like how it's so clean and the service is fast and simple.

Great food and amazing atmosphere. This is as real as BBQ food gets! Been here a few times and tried the baby back ribs and beef rib, both are amazing. Their Mac n cheese is also delicious. It's a little pricey but it's worth it if you like authentic BBQ.

Smell of oak wood smoke fills Texas BBQ House.  I love the sweet aroma and the nice staff.  This is the friendliest bbq I've been to in Arizona.  While waiting at the counter to order the helpful cashier offers me a piece of beef brisket to help me decide what to get.  It was melt in your mouth tender and full of smoky flavor.  They have 3 different options in the level of moisture/fat in the brisket.  I chose the moist which they were sampling.  The fat rendered down during hours of smoking in their oak pellet filled smoker.  Amazingly moist it's one of the best beef briskets I've had.  Brisket was a deal at $11 for a half pound.

I also tried a $17 beef rib and a half pound of beef brisket for $11.  Beef rib was huge and full of meat.  Very tender beef cooked to medium-medium well.  Loved the flavor from the dry rub and oak smoke. 

Service is really good here.  A couple under 18 kids were keeping the place clean and greeting the guests.  I've never been to Texas but if all the bbq is as good as here I'm gonna have to go.

The more that I visit BBQ joints across the valley, the more I love Texas BBQ House.  The food is always delicious and the staff are quick and helpful.  By this point, I've had most everything on the menu and it's all wonderful.  My favorite BBQ place in Phoenix.

I've had a chance to eat some of the best BBQ in Texas (Snows's, Louie Muellers, Blacks, etc) and I'm sorry to say that this is not close to any of them. On my first trip I had some of the moist brisket, some ribs and some sausage.  The ribs were okay, but could have used a spicier rub on the meat. Not much smoke on them either. The brisket is so-so. Granted that this is the only place I've found in the valley to serve moist brisket or even give you a choice, but the meat was lacking flavor. It was tender though. The sauce is sweet and lacking a kick either from vinegar or spice, but if the meat is good who cares about the sauce. Sausage was just okay, didn't taste smoke on the sausage at all. I'll try this place one more time, but there are better places in the valley where the BBQ has more flavor from the rub and smoke than Texas BBQ house. I was really excited to try this place after reading the reviews, but was let down
Hopefully the second time I try will be better

This food is great!!  I would highly recommend the moist beef brisket, BBQ chicken that falls off the bone, coleslaw, and pinto beans!  The owner/chef will let you sample the brisket. After one bite, you will be hooked. Also, you can order a side of the brisket by weight. I did a combination plate of qtr BBQ chicken and 1/2 lb. of beef brisket.  Yes, I was hungry, and I ate every last bit. My co-workers enjoyed their meals, but recommended that you skip the sweet tea, unless you like super sweet tea. 

Enjoy!!

I gotta admit it does stink prices went up. I had not been here since vefore prices went up by another 3 or 4. I tried the cutters choice brisket. It had a good flavor but kind of dried. Also first time trying a spare ribs. Gotta say im a fan! Love their spicy bbq sauce as always. THE ONE THING I REALIZED THIS TIME AROUND IS THAT THEIR JALAPENOS ARE AMAZING. Always crunchy and spicy. Need to find out what brand they are.

Been here a dozen times now. I arrived at noon on a Thursday and it was 3/4 full. As I left, there were at least twelve in line. Probably for the 'Thursday only' rib tips. 

They were already out of tips by noon, so I got a half pound of moist brisket, a half sausage link plus a drink. 

The owner, Mike, is a Dallas Cowboys fan. I will forgive him for that since he smokes such succulent meats. 

I will be making numerous repeat visits.

I am a fan of this great bbq joint. 2nd visit today & their brisket is awesome! I tried the creamed corn & it may be one if the best things I have ever had. 

The spicy bbq sauce is delish & comes on the side in squeeze bottles. Parking could be tough during lunch hour but worth the trip! Food comes out right away & everyone is quite friendly here.

I'm not sure where all these good reviews are coming for this place, but I have had way better BBQ than this and the 8 other people with me agreed, we aint goin back. ( with a southern draw of course)   I was very excited to see a BBQ joint in Old town Scottsdale since I am a avid BBQ fan.  I also do a lot of my own meat smoking and love the smells and flavors so I do have some background in it   I was terribly disappointed in this place.  I ordered the 1/2 lb. BBq plate w/ coleslaw and sweet tea   First off, I don't mind the "pay by pound" idea in a BBQ joint but I don't like it when BBQ comes drenched in BBQ sauce, and when I mean drenched it was soaked in sauce. I like to put the sauce on myself.  Which leads me to something else I didn't like about this place, the BBQ sauce itself.  WAY to sweet.  To me when  a sauce is to sweet your covering up to much of the meat flavor.  I can put there sauce on a Mc Rib and will taste the same. :) not to knock the famous Mc Rib.
There spicy sauce was actually better but since my meat already came slathered in sweet sauce I couldn't use it.   The potato salad and coleslaw seemed mast produced, in other words they bought it from a supplier, I don't know if this is true but the 8 other people I sat with last sunday all said the same thing.  With my 1/2 lb plate came white  "FRY"s" sandwich bread, no joke.   If you wanted to get an actual bun for BBQ sandwiches it was $.99 extra. 

Again I'm not sure where these good reviews are coming from but if I were you I would stay away and try another BBQ joint, I'm not going to give any suggestions because then people would think I'm an owner of that "other"  joint, I'm just going to suggest that there are way better place then here.   Did I mention the Sweet tea was good?

Best BBQ Spot in South Phoenix! First time here and definitely not the last! They gave us samples of the brisket to try. And damn it was amazing! The brisket is where it's at, it was not tough and you can tell it was made with passion.. 

The BBQ sauce they have reg and spicy both are amazing! The spicy has a kick but it's one where you can't stop eating it! Hubby got the Po Boy and he has no regrets and even though he was full he still kept eating it was so good! 

Definitely coming back for more!
I've been coming here for years.   Hands down best BBQ in town.  The brisket is to die for!!!

The best brisket in town and you better get there early! They sell out for a reason, it is so darn good, I have now gotten in the habit of going over there before noon buying a pound of moist brisket, sides of slaw, mac n cheese, pecan pie, toss in some bread, some spicy and sweet sauce and I've taken care of lunch and dinner. Winner winner!!

Are lunch there today. Food was very good and served quickly and the owners young boys were there hustling around cleaning tables, suggesting different sauces and getting drink refills. A bit off the beaten path but worth the stop

Great wet  brisket. Good sides.  

    Small place.  Could not take clients here but a great place for lunch or a quick dinner near the airport.
This place is awesome!!! I recommend there brisket and if you are especially hungry their Texas Po'boy is excellent!

I am leaning towards a 2 star rating but am bumping it up because I thought the service was great and the two boys that helped me carry my order to my car.  I really really wanted to like this place.  It is close to home but doesn't accept credit cards.  That always is annoying.  I like that you are offered a sample if you have never been.  I didn't care that much for the sample so I should have known right there.  I ordered 1 pound of lean brisket as my children do not like fat on their food.  I also ordered some st louis style ribs as they were out of beef ribs.  We added on a small container or creamed corn, a large container of macaroni and cheese and a gallon of sweet tea.  The bill was over $40 for a lunch that I had to bring home and dish out for me and 3 kids.  I think that is pretty pricey!

Everything tasted very peppery to me.  We were offered a choice of spicy or regular BBQ sauce.  They came in identical containers.  One had a marking on top which I couldn't see or notice when I got them home to open them.  I had to taste all of them before offering to kids.  The spicy was way to hot.  The regular was good but it killed my stomach trying to figure out which was which with each container.

I didn't care for the choices of bread - sesame hamburger style buns for a plastic bag or white bread slice.  Was hoping for homemade rolls or biscuits.

Brisket was very forgettable.  The ribs were best of the meats and I am not a fan of pork.  

The creamed corn was by far the best part of the meal.  This was the only thing that I actually enjoyed.  Mmmmmm....

The macaroni and cheese was $8 and got thrown away with only what we sampled gone from the top.  Sad because mac & ch is one of my all time favorite foods, same with the kids.  Tons of flakes of black pepper.  Didn't like anything about it.
