I am not a big BBQ fan but let me tell you............... Went in and ordered the Po Boy, they gave me a sample of the brisket. That was the best piece of meat I ever had.  The sandwich was pretty darn good as well. Had a sausage link some brisket and some pulled pork. Was mighty tasty. Its a bit pricey though, 13 bucks for this beast but was delicious ! The sausage is a bit peppery but great flavor !

Very simple and delicious brisket. Their homemade spicy BBQ sauce was awesome, and the service was super quick and friendly. We got to try the sides before picking the pinto beans. The chicken was also moist. Very big servings and ziplock bags are ready for leftovers. Simple atmosphere, no fuss, country music and sports in the tv. Awesome!

This is one of the best options out there for BBQ in Phoenix.  I ordered the cutter's choice brisket with a side order of macaroni and cheese.  The brisket was decent and the macaroni and cheese was average to me.  I would like to try and go back to try their turkey or ribs.

To me, Little Miss BBQ has better brisket and it's my favorite bbq place around.  However, this place has better hours of operation.

I would recommend this place because the bbq is good and the customer service is great.

Parking: It's a little sketchy with the barber shop next door but still not bad, plenty of parking.

Entrance:
Greeted by a couple of cashiers not sure which is willing to take my order. 

Food:
I order jalapeno sausage and regular sausage to see what the two were like. Mind you guys my review has a 31 years of experience of Texas bbq eatin. Always about the good ol sausage. However, this was not the experience I was looking for. I got it to go and when I got to where I was going, I decided to dive into the Jalapeno sausage and after unwrapping it, just by looking at I notice it looked super dry. I was even afraid to take a bite of it. I did it anyways and it was disgusting, I wouldn't have served that to any guys. Owners if you are going to use the Texas name, you sure as the hell need to get it together. You're not representing Texas in great spirit. I'm actually kind of upset your using the name and selling that crap to anyone for that matter. I'm not going to discredit the regular sausage because it wasn't as dry and tasted pretty good. But let's just say the jalapeno sausage left a bad taste behind.

Why not a 5:
Well no need to go into details, hopefully you fix your issues, not sure how you became highly rated, but I'm in hopes my next visit I'll be able to see why. True Texan believes in second chances.
Pulled Pork Sandwich. Cream Corn. Mac & Cheese. Pecan Pie. Sweet. AMAZINGGGGGGG!!! Now back to eAting.

Friendly service and good prices for downtown Scottsdale but mediocre food puts the kabosh on this place.  Chicken was pretty tasty but the jalapeno sausage was horrible.  Got a free sample of the brisket and while tasty seeing the cook butcher the slab and scraping off the crust was horrific in bbq terms.
Awesome food at a great price!!  BBQ sauce is outstanding!  HUGE portions, friendly atmosphere,  LOVE IT!!

- The moist brisket was full of smoky flavor and had the perfect amount of fat.

- The pulled pork was a little bland and had too much sauce.

- The sausage links were perfect. Just a hint of smoke and still crisp and juicy.

- The green beans were delicious.  The potato salad was above average. The mac n cheese was ok.

- The mud pudding was pretty good, but describing it as a blizzard with pudding instead if ice cream made me want to go to DQ.

- Prices are a little high for BBQ in AZ, but on par with what I've experienced in TX.

- Very friendly staff.

My family and I will definitely be back.  It's our sole good BBQ option in AZ now.

Being from Texas, I am skeptical about all things barbecue and chicken fried outside of home.  Most places, hard as they try, will never get it right.  That being said, Texas BBQ House was like stepping into a teleporter that brought me right back to the doorstep of home.  
Served up in a traditional Texas style, you walk up to the counter and order various meats by the pound.  They are sliced right in front of you, placed on butcher paper and set in a plastic crate.  You grab cold sides from a reach in fridge and order hot sides from one of the nice men at the counter.  They've got sweet tea, the good Coke (the Mexican kind in the bottle that still has real sugar), and IBC in a bottle.  Doesn't get much better than that.  Every single meat (and I do believe we tried them all) was moist and just seemed to fall apart as you picked it up.  A quality Famous Dave's has yet to master with their brisket.  The boyfriend and I decided to try order as much as we could, stuff ourselves, and go home with leftovers.  As we ordered, the staff would cut us both samples of each meat.  We were not disappointed in a single one.   After loading up on brisket, jalapeno sausage, pork loin, and ribs, they brought us samples of the creamed corn and pinto beans.  Both were excellent, but we just went with creamed corn (like we didn't already have enough food).  And what kind of barbecue dinner is complete without potato salad and coleslaw?  So, we threw both of those on as well. In true Texas tradition, they hand you as many slices of white sandwich bread as you'd like, you pay, and you're on your way to carnivore heaven.  
Like I said, everything we had was delicious and I guarantee this little gem would not be shunned back home.  There are LCD televisions in every corner and they'll put on whatever game you'd like to watch.  It's chilly now, but during the nicer months you can enjoy your feast outside on picnic benches under a covered patio.  It's in the middle of nowhere, (24th street and Broadway) we nearly missed it, but they are opening a second location in Scottsdale sometime in January 2012.  I think I'll still head out to this one, though, as I can't really see myself eating barbecue around the Scottsdale crowd.  They close early (7 pm) so don't waste daytime.  
Next time I'm in, we'll try not to overload ourselves and leave room for dessert.  I'm eager to try the banana pudding and the boyfriend loves pecan pie. So, I'll update on that as soon as we get hungry again.

Went there again today. Had the Texas po-boy. Super good. Probably the best bbq sandwich I've ever had. The creamed corn was outstanding. High recomedations to all. Every time I go here it's very, very good. Again best brisket I've had...recomend the one with some fat on it.

Tasty Pulled pork with option of how hot you want the sauce. Nice people working there so fast polite service with a sweet smile:) Always busy at lunch so you know it's good and I was in and out (take out order) in 8 mins - perfect for local lunch!

The brisket is wonderful, super tasty bark, nice smoke ring.  We got the cutters choice which is in between the juicy yet fattier cut and the lean cut, a good all round compromise.  Wasn't a big fan of the sauces, not bad but nothing spectacular but the brisket is so good you really dont need any.

The mac&cheese is good, as is the cole slaw, wasn't a fan of the cream corn, just too sweet for me. I wish they had some greens to choose from.

I literally just demolished the Texas po boy in 15 minutes. Awesome bbq served the right way, smoked fresh in house, cut fresh when ordered, dry except the pulled pork and chopped brisket, but sauce is on the table. House made of course. A tiny little shop with a tiny patio that's worth seeking out if you're in the South valley! I'll be back for sure.

Delicious. The brisket was fantastic. Everything was good. 

Can't wait to come back again!!!

The search for amazing barbeque in Phoenix is over!  I have driven past the BBQ house for a few months, always wanting to stop and finally did.  Walking in ordering my food, I was reminded of Rudy's, and as I ate my brisket i was throughly impressed.

The brisket is moist and flavorful, the potato salad was amazing and the atmosphere was perfect.

By far the best barbeque in Phoenix, I've already recommended this restaurant to friends and co-workers!

This place gets a solid 5 stars for the meats and the service!!!  I ordered the pork loin (ordered chopped) and creamed corn which were extremely good.  I also tried the lean brisket and moist brisket.  The sample of moist brisket was the best I have ever tasted; I would have ordered it, but sampled it after I bought the pork loin.

I have to knock it down one star for a few reasons, but I will be back many, many times for sure!   I was not a big fan of the banana pudding; it did not taste very fresh today.  A couple of the reviewers noted how good it was; I may have ordered it on an off day.   I am also disappointed that you can not order a traditional sandwich; basically, they give you white sandwich bread and offer to chop the meat up for you.  There is only one type of BBQ sauce, and I am not a huge fan of it.  But as the other reviewers noted, the meat tastes so good you may not even want any sauce!!!

Fast, simple, affordable and a very high quality product to boot. Power to Texas BBQ as old town definitely needs more high-quality food served quickly. I loved my brisket (avoid the lean cut - too dry). The sauce is incredible.

Best BBQ PO' BOY I've ever had!! Love the spicy bbq sauce - sweet and has just enough kick to it, meat - tender with so much flavor , even the bread was so good! The Mac n' cheese and coleslaw was tasty too. They have good ice tea, tastes freshly brewed. I'll definitely be back the next time I crave bbq!

I'm originally from Texas & this is the closest to "home" bbq in the Valley!  Even my NYC boyfriend loved it!  Reasonably priced with a great selection with nice-sized portions!  The brisket was cooked perfectly; and is good with OR without the wonderful bbq sauce!

I didn't feel like waiting in line for an hour at the other critically acclaimed BBQ place not far from here so I decided to give Texas BBQ house a try and I'm glad I did.

It was a Friday so I was disappointed to find out that they were out of ribs, pulled pork, and chicken. But they were able to throw together a custom sampler plate for me with their brisket, turkey, and 2 types of sausage. It did not disappoint.

The brisket was "fatty brisket" and it was packed with flavor. I'm a BBQ junkie so I've had some of the best brisket in the world and their brisket is right up there.

The Turkey might have been the best BBQ turkey I've ever had. Sliced thick, tender, and packed with flavor.

Their jalapeno sausage did outshine their regular sausage, but both were fantastic. 

This place is as good as it gets.

This is definitely my favorite barbecue spot in Arizona. They are consistent with their food and the customer service is always on point. I like my Brisket with a little fat on it and their cutting is perfect. My girlfriend likes hers with fat all the way through and I must say it's pretty good also. Their St. Louis Ribs are tender and flavorful before the sauce is even thought about, and the Hot Links while smaller than I'm use to pack a nice punch of spice and flavor. I also like that the Mac & Cheese is cheesy, already seasoned, and not runny like its out of a cheap box. The Green Beans are also full of flavor with just the right amount of meat mixed in. I can't wait to go back and eat. 

Now I recommend calling ahead if your going after work or close to closing time. They once ran out of every meat except pulled pork, but that's when I knew I was going to be back. If they run out of meat it must be good! 

#FoodJones on IG

Not bad.

I tried this place out a little while back as I had passed it many times and finally decided to check the reviews on the place.  I was surprised to find such high reviews this place so I figured what the heck?

I love BBQ and can't get enough of a good brisket.  So we decided to try the brisket here.  The guy told us that they only have so much per day and it is best to come in earlier to ensure that we get some.  We decided to try the moist and the cutter's choice and a couple variations of sauce, original and spicy.  

Overall, it wasn't bad.  The moist brisket definitely lives up to the name and the cutter's choice had a pretty good texture to it.  The spicy sauce had more spice than flavor though.  I would recommend the cutter's choice and the original sauce personally.  It isn't as good as some of the BBQ I have had in New Orleans but it is decent for something closer to home if the hankering arises.  

If you haven't tried it yet, I think you will enjoy it.

I only just stumbled on my having given Texas a 4 start because they were cash only back in the day, but now that that's long been resolved, it's fully deserving of 5-star. The brisket is some of the best I've ever had. The smoked wings are a thing of beauty. The mac and cheese is amazing. This place does true BBQ right, and without the 3 hour wait of some other joints.

Amazeballs!!!!

This is not just some of the best barbecue in Arizona this is some of the best barbecue in the country. These people know what's up. Moist brisket and the spareribs will blow your mind. Not to mention the fact that they carry beef ribs! That's amazing

The place is def a dump however and seating is fairly limited. They need one of these on the East Side!

DOWNSIDE: CRAZY EXPENSIVE considering they are in a bad neighborhood and their rent is probably nothing. They are def proud of their BBQ to charge what they do for it.

This is the place to go for BBQ if your flying in/out or have a layover in Phenoix.  Hands down some of the best brisket I've had in a long time.  So close to the airport that with a long layover it would be easy to step out for a bit and grab a bite.  You can order in pounds if you like but they always have daily specials for a quick meal.  The BBQ sauce rivals that I've had before in Nashville. A must stop if your in town.
We were looking for a quick bite to eat and found this gem on Yelp. Great BBQ and friendly service!

I picked up lunch today. I made my order online. Good service when I got there. I returned home and realized they forgot my potato salad. I picked up the phone to call and let them know. I saw they called me first and left a message. I called back, they adked if I wanted to drive back up there for it. I decided to take the refund. Where I got my receipt online they refunded the total amount of both lunches I bought. That made the difference between a bad experience and feeling a little bonded to this place. BTW - the food is really good.
First time here and it was hands down amazing. BBQ sliders were so  delicious and ribs were so tender fell right off of the bone. Great friendly servi. We will be back
I've had better but this one was good, better than I've found so far in Phoenix. But it was a bit pricey for me and inconvenient that they only accept cash.

The best Texas BBQ is not in Texas, it's in the heart of Phoenix. No wonder this place has high reviews and really famous in the area. Don't be scared of the outside setting (i did but still went in); the service is good and noticed their kitchen has nice appliances too. Will definitely go back. Tenderest meats and yummy BBq sauce! 2 thumbs up!!!
Bomb.com. Cashier gave us nice size samples of the brisket and it was perfect. Ate to quick to snap pics , but the pulled pork sliders are delish. Lunch specials include side and drink.

Love walking into a place where the owners remember who you are no matter how long it's been between visits!  The food is amazing as always and the service is great to boot...check them out and feel free to tell them that "southwest chick" sent you!!!

I'm so happy they put a location in Old Town.  I had been to the location in South Phoenix before and it was awesome as well.  

I had the Chopped BBQ which is Turkey, Chicken, and Beef all chopped up and cooked in BBQ sauce.  It was very very tasty.  They gave me two pieces of bread to make a sandwich and with the 1/2lb order I still had more left over.  

For my side I got the Texas Cream Corn which I really enjoy.  It has great flavor and is an excellent compliment to the BBQ.  

The location has a nice patio for the great weather we are having and you can also sit inside on picnic style tables.

Stilll the best BBQ is Arizona.  The kid ate the "Po' Boy", a pound total of sausage, brisket, and pulled pork.  Yummy.  What few asked, so what's good here?  I said, "it's all good in da hood".  Cause they're in the hood.

Hate to do it, but today's meal was whack and totally deserving of this one star rating!

I had this place bookmarked for awhile and am seriously trying to hit a low carb diet pretty hard in order to lose some weight.  Low carb options are somewhat limited when eating out, so I figured a plate of meat would fit the bill.  I drove down, parked in the lot, and walked inside.

I asked the cashier lady (very friendly btw...best part of the visit) how everything worked.  She explained how everything is served by weight and even gave me a sample of fatty brisket to sample since it was my first time here.  I decided to go with a 1/4lb fatty brisket, a sausage link, and 3 pork spare ribs.  That and a fountain drink came out to $27.50!  I know BBQ is expensive, but sheesh!  It better be good for almost $30.00!  I took my tray to my table and dug in.  Here is how everything was...........

Fatty Brisket-  This was the best meat of the bunch, and even then, it was barely edible.  I am down with the fat.  Fat=flavor.  I am NOT down with whale blubber, gelatinous type fat.  This brisket had a huge bark of whale blubber fat.  I picked off most of it, and ate the actual meat part and it was decent.  Not the worst brisket I have ever had (Rudy's in Goodyear takes the cake on that one!), but nowhere even close to the best brisket I have had.  1/4lb is about 2 slices.  Probably should have tried the lean?  Who the hell knows....disappointed though! 

Sausage Link-  Dry and chewy.  Flavor wasn't that great either!  Reminded me of eating a dried up hot dog.  At almost $5.00 for this link, I felt it was not worth it at all.  I made my way through about half of the link and couldn't eat any more.

Pork Spare Ribs-  These things were huge.  That is not necessarily good though.  The outside bark had a decent peppery taste, but the meat was a little tough, tasted like it was boiled, and just flat out didn't smell or taste too appealing.  I made my way through about 3/4 of one rib and was done...couldn't eat any more.  

I boxed up my remaining sausage and 2 ribs and gave them to a homeless lady standing by the 17 freeway entrance.  While I was there at the light, she sat down, opened the box, took a couple of bites and then closed the box and stood back up to continue begging on the side of the road.  That right there should tell you something....a hungry, homeless person didn't even like the ribs and sausage enough to sit there and eat them!  Fuck, right?  

Not sure how so many people love this place.  Service was very friendly, and that is the only positive thing I have to say about this visit.  There are way better BBQ places in town (Little Miss, Naked BBQ, even Rudy's is better than this joint!).  As I write this, about 4 hours later, my stomach hurts and it feels like I have to barf. $27.50 poorer...all for some barely edible BBQ.  Horrible!  I will never come back!

Great bbq! I don't typically enjoy bbq, but I enjoyed the Texas Po boy sandwich I got here. It's a 1 lb sandwich filled with pulled pork, cutter's choice brisket, and link sausage. The meat was very tender and juicy. Meanwhile, the sausage added a nice kick of spice to each bite. The bun was nice a soft. The portion was also huge -- I could only eat half the sandwich. I saved the other half for later, and it was just as good (maybe ever better) later!

Service was good and fast. Upon arrival, we were offered samples of meat, which were delicious! We also used the check-in offer on Yelp to save a few bucks. Once your food is ready, it is placed in a big blue bin instead of plates, which is fine by me.

Hot diggity damn, there's a new BBQ place in town (and by "town" I am referring directly to the imaginary place my dreams occur in.) 

The pulled pork and coleslaw are not to be missed (shredded things drenched in tasty sauce = all systems go), and save room for the old-fashioned banana pudding. Not many folks in the Southwest can make a banana pudding like these fellas... and even fewer can make my mother literally pull the dessert we're sharing away from me and finish it before I've had my second bite. 

Between BBQ sauce that I'd lick off the bottom of an old cowboy boot and brisket that makes me feel disloyal to my own grandmother's secret recipe, these are the areas where Texas BBQ truly shines. There's no question that this comfy hole-in-the-wall knows how to put a sauce-stained smile on my face.

"I have the meat sweats"

AWE AWESOME all the way around. Brisket was perfect,Texas poor boy simply fantastic,Jalapeno link was amazing & the mac&cheese was off the chain.
My 1st experience was this past Saturday & I drove from Surprise needless to say I will be back.Be prepared to open your wallet & enjoy all that they have to offer.

I was on a quest...BBQ and smoked goodness that could meet or beat the standard set by my favorite BBQ place, Rudy's, which is a Texas based chain with locations in Albuquerque. I rarely give 5 stars on first visit and this was pretty darn close...by PHX standards this is easily 5 stars!

Fate delivered an article in a local food Blog, It was touted as being like Rudy's as a result I took that as a challenge. Via Yelp I bookmarked it to try.  
The locations is clean and casual. Just enough booths and tables and a small outside patio. The employees and the owner/manager were very friendly and helpful. He gave me a sample of their brisket. While not as smoked as I like was super tender and delicious. I decided on their Yelp Check In special (which is also a regular daily special) of 1/3# Brisket, side, bread and drink for $7.99. Here you buy the items a la carte and the meat by the pound. Like Rudy's there are no plates as they serve and you eat on Butcher paper. For my side I choose Creamed Corn...he gave me a sample first and dare I say this was better than Rudy's. 

 What I love that other places lack is the little bar with sliced onions, dill pickle slices and pickled whole jalapeños. The bread offered is your simple sliced loaf bread, his is traditional and typical of Texas style BBQ joints. You put a little meat onions, pickle and sauce o keep a slice of bread fold in half/eat taco style and enjoy.
The sauce is a hint sweeter than I like, but the smoked flavor was what I enjoyed most. 
I didn't see smoked baked potatoes on the menu, nor did I see the cobblers that Rudy's carries but that may come later. They do have have pecan pie, banana pudding to satisfy your sweet tooth. I already am planning my next trip so I can try more items on the menu.  They also have a nice small selection of bottled beer. What's BBQ without beer or fresh brewed sweet tea which they have as well.
I was too full to dig into my homemade banana pudding. 

Rudy's...you've found your match and I have found my go to BBQ in the valley.
[It's CASH ONLY. They do have an ATM on site.]
Great place to eat. Very helpful when choosing items or can't decide on what to order. I got brisket and pulled pork. They were delicious, just wanted to try everything on the menu.
The PO Boy was delicious! ; but it was expensive and it didn't come with sides. The place is small, very personal, and the  workers weren't the most welcoming.

Checked out Texas BBQ House while visiting Phoenix on a work trip. Tried the lean and fatty brisket, as well as the jalapeño sausage. The sausage was out of this world - probably one of the best smoked sausages I've ever had. The brisket, on the other hand, was just okay. In general, at least for my palate, the smoke flavor was too subtle - parts of the lean meat without the bark tasted like brisket coming out of an oven, despite the amazing smoke ring. I'd probably go back for the sausage, but in my opinion, a place that dares to put "Texas" and "BBQ" in its name absolutely has to nail brisket.

TEXAS PO BOY

AMAZING

This sandwich changed my perspective on BBQ. I'm  usually not a huge fan and could care less. This food was incredible and I absolutely could not finish it despite my trying due to how filling and large it was. (Apparently people usually split it)

I didn't photograph the establishment but I should have photographed the line GOING OUT THE DOOR. I beat the lunch rush, but let me tell you, the wait is worth it.
This place is yummy!  Love when I find these gems, thank you Yelp!  Brisket is so good and I love their green beans wow!!! Will definitely be back as the hubby loves his bbq.

Note: CASH ONLY ... ok now that we got that out of the way ... Fabulous BBQ with amazing service. Great flavor - they'll let you sample a bit before you order just so you know what you're getting. Great quality meats with amazing flavor. Real Texas BBQ. We'll definitely be back. Take out or dine in ... just remember CASH ONLY!

I have been coming here since this placed opened. service was great at first, but now that they are getting really busy, you got to wait in line for awhile to get your food at busy times, service is ok. so expect to wait in line if it's busy. food is still great though, so i try and go when it's not busy at all, don't go at noon:)

Just had an amazing meal. Had the sampler. It was full of amazing awesomeness.

This is easily the best BBQ place in Phoenix. Don't miss it!

Omg this is the best kept secret in Phoenix . The Texas Po'boy is unreal sausage pork tenderloin and pulled pork is a must try. The Ribs are phenomenal  tender moist and meaty. Please try this place I promise you will not be sorry!!!!

The BBQ at this place is insanely good!!! The first order I ever had was the moist brisket and experienced a tiny bit of heaven. I've never really had genuine before Texas BBQ but if this is it I'm completely sold. 

All that aside it's at a great location and the food is high quality. They do not give you plates so be prepared to eat with your hands. I've been here several times after my initial visit and have sampled many of different meats that they offer. I've been impressed everytime and highly recommend Texas BBQ to anyone looking for great tasting meal especially barbeque

There is nothing fancy in this place.  Very simple presentation of very good food.  I ordered the brisket and pork loin, and both were quite good.  I purposely got a pound of food so I could take some home as leftovers.  Friendly, helpful staff.  The mac and cheese was homemade and tasty as well.  

The neighborhood isn't the greatest, but that's OK.

Seriously the best BBQ brisket I've ever had!  It's hard to find good BBQ in California where I'm from, so I have to search for spots when I travel.  Found this gem and was I impressed!  

Spoke with the owners after my meal to learn more. The owner's (husband and wife) run the place as the chef and cashier.  They are from Corpus Christi, TX, so they indeed can claim "Texas BBQ" to their name.

Brisket was incredible moist and tender.  They apparently smoke their brisket in Oakwood for 18 hours.  Also samples Pulled Pork, St. Louis ribs, and a hot link.  Pulled Pork was also 5-stars!  Ribs and hot link weren't anything special but were still tasty (Phil's BBQ in San Diego still is king of ribs IMO).  

If you give Texas BBQ house a try (and you certainly should) definitely stick to Brisket and Pulled Pork.  It's phenomenal.

I'm picky about my BBQ. I really am and I rarely like eating it out. But this place is amazing. Brisket...incredible. Sides are amazing, the sweet tea is spot on. Now they have sandwich specials for lunch (with a small side). I can't stay away. Pulled pork sliders and this unreal meat mountain sandwich they call a Texas po boy. Wow.  
Stopped in for a larger order to take to work and they very nicely filled it for me even though I didn't call ahead. Great people, great food!
Always a great meal. From the brisket to the turkey (and especially the po-boy). One of the best Texas BBQ places in town with minimal wait and fuss.

In Phoenix. Trusted my yelp buds and found his place. Was not disappointed. Yum. Yum. The brisket was off the charts and fell apart and melted in your mouth the ribs were not the best ever but they were excellent. It was the brisket that was beyond compare. I love this place. Super nice people down home food. All da best!

Unlike most of the folks who wrote real reviews down below, I'm not from TX and I've never tried TX BBQ.  I can't compare it to any place in Austin, Dallas or Lubbock.  But I have taste buds.  And they liked it.  They liked it a lot.  

I love BBQ.  Sure, there's better and worse BBQ around town based on where ya go, but generally speaking if I go to a BBQ place, I'm going to enjoy myself.  But that doesn't mean I'm going to recommend the place, or come back again, and it really doesn't mean that I'm going to write a review on it.  But as I sit here wondering how I ate that whole freaking sandwich, I know that I have just had one of the best BBQ nights in a long, long time.  And once my stomach isn't full (say, tomorrow afternoon?) I'll be calling friends to plan our next trip there.  

OM-frickin-G it is awesome!  As has been mentioned in other reviews they hooked us up with some samples when we said we hadn't been there before.  Sure, their brisket leaves this taste of buttery meat in your mouth (if you don't understand that, I'm sorry for you) and makes you want much much more - but why has no one mentioned the turkey?  We only got a sample of it, but DANG I could eat a lot of that!  One day when I'm trying to be "healthy" I'll get that but today was not that day.

I got what I believe was called the Big ol' Boy sandwich.  When he called back for the guys to make it he said to make a BIg ol' Girl.  Nice touch dude.  So the sandwich is 1/3 pound each of BBQ chopped pork, brisket and hot links.  I am not a fan of hot links, but figured I'd give it a shot as I liked the general concept (It actually comes out as a sandwich vs. it being a make your own thing...).  I LOVED the hotlinks.  That casing had an awesome "pop" as you bit into it, had a black pepper-y hint that I loved, and was good enough that I would almost contemplate trying one solo.  And I have NEVER felt that way about a hot link before.

Between our samples and our meals I got to try all 3 kinds of brisket and I don't know that I'll be able to tell you my favorite.  Like picking a favorite child.  Sure, Bobby is the juiciest, but Jimmy tastes intense and smokey...well, you know what I mean...

Not sure how new this is - but they now have 2 BBQ sauces for your eating pleasure.  Normal and HOT.  Hot won't burn your lip, but definitely makes the tongue to a double take.

And the service.  Clap... Clap... Clap..Clap..Clap.Clap.Clap.Clap!!!  Right on point.  By the end of the end of our introduction to the food we knew what things were made fresh that day, what things were made every other day or weekly, and which ones came from his Grandma's kitchen. Review done.  Tummy still full.  Texting friends to make our next trip...
Not bad but I've had better.  I give the brisket a B-.  It was good.  I certainly wouldn't call meat smoked on a pellet cooker Texas BBQ.

From my vegetarian perspective (I went with my Texan, carnivorous husband), I had to try all the sides with #1 being the tastiest:
1. Cream Corn
2. Potato Salad
3. Coleslaw
4. Mac & Cheese
My husband says the brisket had good bark, was moist, and worthy of an hour drive, which won't really work since we live in Sedona. While I was writing this review, he ate all my sides, and now I am pissed.

I went by Texas BBQ House today, and it appears they have closed down already. I thought the extra lean brisket there was decent, but not as good as Rudy's, which I recommend as an alternative. One thing that rankled me about Texas BBQ House was the high price on the stuffed baked potato. Another issue was the parking. Finally, the dining area was very cramped. I've never been to the South Phoenix location, but if I'm going to drive that far, I would go to Rudy's instead.

This is real Texas bbq. The brisket is excellent as well as the sausage. Side dishes are great as well. Very busy place in south Phoenix and the parking lot gets filled up quickly. Certainly worth the drive from east Mesa. This is as good bbq as you will find even in south Texas.

I would have given this 3.5 stars if it was an option. I ordered the fatty brisket (.5 lb serving), a side of potato salad, and a cup for water. It was $11 after a $3 off coupon they offered for Yelp users. The value was fine, as this is about the market rate for BBQ. I noticed the menu had a few lunch specials that appeared to have a solid value. 

The location is just off the northeast corner of the intersection and parking is limited. I would recommend carpooling if you plan on visiting with others. We arrived during the noon hour and service was concise and cordial. If you don't have time to wait out Little Miss BBQ - the best BBQ in Phoenix, in my estimation - this would seem to be a timely alternative and not far from the interstate. There's a fair amount of seating outside and picnic tables on the patio.

The brisket was good. Definitely above average but it didn't stand out. If I could go back, I would have ordered lean brisket because the fatty wasn't trimmed properly and there was some waste I had to cut off myself. If the price was a little lower, again, $9.30 is certainly reasonable for a half-pound, I could more easily excuse there being some waste. The flavor and moisture were both solid, though the burnt ends were a bit rubbery. There wasn't a strong smoky flavor to it but it was still satisfying. 

As for the sides, the potato salad was decent. Nothing remarkable but certainly complementary with the brisket. The portion was pre-scooped into a cup and refrigerated. A friend I was with ordered the mac 'n cheese which I found to be quite good. The cheese was silky and had a pinch of pepper dashed in to add some dimension. 

Overall, I was pleased with my experience and there was nothing, in a vacuum, that would keep me from returning. If I find myself craving some BBQ in the future and I don't have the time to wait at Little Miss, this is certainly an alternative I would consider.
Took the fam here the other night and was thoroughly impressed! Usually brisket isn't done right and ends up dry, but they did it perfectly! Pretty sure it's my husband's new favorite BBQ place :)

In general, I love BBQ.  I grew up with a mom who raked snow and ice off the grill to BBQ in the winter!  

I tried a few BBQ places when I first moved here, but I gave up on BBQ in Phoenix shortly after moving here and I didn't eat BBQ unless I cooked it.  Unfortunately for  all BBQ places in Phoenix (past, present and future), as far as I am concerned, there is LMBBQ(I try not to use another business' name in my reviews) and then there are all other BBQ places in Phoenix.  

I stopped here on a whim to give this place a second try, 2 years after the first time.  I was underwhelmed by the food that I tried.  I ordered the Po'Boy sandwich... a mountain of meat... sausage, brisket (chef's choice), and pulled pork.  The meat was far too saucy for me.  I do not care for sauce on my BBQ.  I prefer the sauce as a garnish,  on the side. I think it was added to the sandwich and I wish I had been asked. The sauce wasn't very tasty itself.  The brisket was tender and juicy, but it lacked a deep smokey flavor that I enjoy!  Same for the brisket.  The sausage on my sandwich didn't taste fresh,  so I didn't eat it more than a bite or two.   Rather unfortunate because I bet normally the regular sausage is good. 

The only bright spot was the jalapeno sausage I ordered on the side that, it JUST occurred to me, didn't taste like it was spiced with jalapeno, but black pepper.  Nevertheless,  the sausage was not greasy and it tasted pretty good.   

i really would like to see BBQ places in and around Phoenix win, but this place is didn't satisfy my taste-buds.  For Phoenix, I suppose it meets some folks needs.  For me, its a "do not return", unless LMBBQ burns down.

Return Factor - 1%.
